alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Choctaw and northern Clarke Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Coffeeville, or 20 miles south of Butler, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thomasville, Coffeeville and Fulton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
